ncliang

timeline.bodyText: nit: value of stopped doesn't help much with clarity here. Maybe something like taskId?
timeline.author: ncliang

replies.bodyText: Good point. That was actually leftover from debugging. Removed.
replies.author: kkonstantine

timeline.author: ncliang

timeline.bodyText:
workerConfig.getBoolean(String) is cached, but there's also the extra logic of tracking that the property was used. Given how this method is called on every record, it seems worth it to speed this up.
How about either pulling this out to a member variable here or in WorkerConfig and adding a getter method to just return the boolean value?
timeline.author: rhauch

replies.bodyText: Good observation. My thought was that JIT would take care of this pretty soon. But doesn't hurt to add this as a final member variable where it's used.
replies.author: kkonstantine

timeline.author: rhauch

timeline.bodyText: We don't need the sleep here?
timeline.author: rhauch

replies.bodyText: Added to match the other tests. Again the important part is to verify that correctly the tasks are removed and tombstones are sent.
replies.author: kkonstantine

timeline.message: KAFKA-9536: Connector topic tracking integration tests

KAFKA-9536: Fix error message in integration test util

KAFKA-9536: Refactor config flags as member variables
KAFKA-9536: Add integration test for when topic tracking overall is disabled
KAFKA-9536: Use String.join instead of the Utils join method
KAFKA-9536: Fix unit tests broken by the config change
KAFKA-9536: Increase timeout on internal topic assertsions
